name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Iowa research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Iowa ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Iowa ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Iowa research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Iowa research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Iowa Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Iowa research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Iowa Overview—1:59

  3. Follow this research study for Iowa ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Iowa Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Iowa research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Iowa Resources
    ☆ AC—Iowa State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Iowa Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Iowa Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Iowa in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Iowa
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Iowa Minorities

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Iowa.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Iowa in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Iowa
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Iowa in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Iowa
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Iowa Minorities

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Iowa.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Iowa in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Iowa

1. Explore Iowa historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Iowa History

  2. Explore Iowa history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Iowa

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Iowa archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Iowa archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Iowa archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Iowa Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Iowa State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Iowa.
  3. Explore Iowa Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Iowa genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on Iowa research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Iowa ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Iowa city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Iowa Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Iowa city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Iowa city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Iowa ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Iowa city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

section_name: Learn about Iowa vital and census records.

hidden.summary:

  2. Explore links for vital records on the Iowa Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Iowa ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Iowa birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Iowa vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

  2. Search for ☆Iowa historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  3. Search the Iowa Online Historical Newspapers site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Iowa research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Iowa County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Iowa.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Iowa Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Iowa research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Iowa Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Iowa Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Iowa Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Iowa.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Iowa research.
  2. Explore the Iowa research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Iowa research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Iowa in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Iowa Societies

  2. Explore the Iowa Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore Iowa genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Iowa.
